definition: to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
to feel embarrassed/to find it embarrassing/to be sorry (for inconveniencing sb)
not to be trifled with/not to be pushed around/stand no nonsense
hard to say/unpleasant to say/can't be sure

sentences.english: First impressions of Sumatra are not good.
sentences.chinese: 苏门答腊给我的第一印象并不好。

sentences.english: She was embarrassed when they kept telling her she had a genius for mathematics.
sentences.chinese: 他们总是对她说她有数学蠢才，她觉得很不好心思。

sentences.english: Tom is a short fuse, he has bad temper.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆是个急性子，脾气不好。

sentences.english: The spark plugs on modern bikes are always hard to reach.
sentences.chinese: 火星塞很不好取下，因为放置的太深。

sentences.english: Say, read the book you see smoke on the fetal well, easy to teratogenicity .
sentences.chinese: 就说你看到书上写着抽烟对胎儿不好，容易致畸。

sentences.english: This evening I smell bad , don't eat anying.
sentences.chinese: 今天晚上味口不好，没有吃任何东西。

sentences.english: Some words do a miss house not say too to keep white.
sentences.chinese: 有些话做牛观花家的不好说的太过直白了。

sentences.english: This method doesn't work well on resin statues and artificial landscape rocks.
sentences.chinese: 这种方法并不好于树脂和人造景观石头雕像。

sentences.english: Thing is, headphones don’t offer much warmth and getting cold ears isn’t fun.
sentences.chinese: 问题是，耳机不能保暖，耳朵越来越冷这就不好玩了。

sentences.english: Not being able to manage both your Skis can be due to your left and right sides which are aligned differently.
sentences.chinese: 控制不好板子可能是因为你的左右腿型不一致。

sentences.english: Frank, how about some bacon with your French toast ?
sentences.chinese: 弗兰克，弄点儿咸肉就着煎面包片儿吃好不好？

sentences.english: I am only ashamed of his asking so little.
sentences.chinese: 他要得这么少，我倒觉得不好意思呢。

sentences.english: Obviously, Cuiping was nervous and so her smile was not genuine.
sentences.chinese: 翠平显然很紧张，笑声一点儿也不好听。

sentences.english: The youth imagined he was out of sorts, and set to whistling softly.
sentences.chinese: 小伙子以为他情绪不好，就轻轻吹起了口哨。

definition: to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
bad/spoiled/broken/to break down/(suffix) to the utmost
won't do/be out of the question/be no good/not work/not be capable
